title: Chapter 518
content:
> [You have defeated a big poisonous rat.]
> [35,970,411 experience has been acquired.]
> [A big poisonous rat's gallbladder has been acquired.]
> [The big poisonous rat's leather has been acquired.]

> [You have defeated a male big poisonous rat.]
> [21,899,050 experience has been acquired.]

Grid wiped the blood from his blade. The "hamsters," as he'd taken to calling them, clustered near the starter village like vermin. Bottom-feeders in the food chain, probably. Yet the experience they provided was obscene. The females gave seven times what junior vampires offered, five times that of intermediate vampires, and triple the yield of senior vampires.

*Only the males have the gender label. Less experience, too.* Grid studied the corpses. *Matriarchal society?*

Even calling it "less" was a joke. The males still paid out double what a senior vampire was worth.

*Kraugel hunted these things before his third advancement.* Grid's jaw tightened. *Even slowly, he managed it.*

If the rats didn't have that poisoning and confusion breath, Grid would chalk it up to pure skill. Kraugel's technique could overcome raw physical advantages. But the abnormal states were the real problem.

*How did he handle the debuffs?*

Detoxification potions had a ten-second cooldown. Confusion? No potion existed for that. Meanwhile, these things spewed their toxic breath constantly throughout combat.

*Status resistance accessories, maybe.* Grid frowned. *But would he have had those back then?*

A absurd thought crossed his mind. *Did he just... block his nose?*

Grid pinched his nostrils shut experimentally. The stench still wormed its way through, thick and putrid in the back of his throat.

"Ugh."

He staggered out of the tent, stomach churning. Braham's presence stirred in the back of his mind, radiating smug contempt.

'Did you forget what the chef of Pangea said? The monster community formed here after Pangea was invaded.'

Grid spat to clear the taste from his mouth.

'The rats were likely defeated during the invasion and settled here afterwards,' Braham continued. 'They weren't born near the village. Don't assume these big poisonous rats are the weakest monsters on the East Continent.'

"Yeah... you're right."

The logic tracked. Thirty-one people had reached the East Continent in three years since Satisfy's launch. The content here had to be leagues above the West Continent. But Satisfy valued balance. If the continents ever opened trade routes, the gap couldn't be insurmountable.

*These hamsters can't be the baseline.* Grid straightened. *If they were, it would mean every soldier on this continent could match them. That makes no sense.*

"Whatever." He rolled his shoulders. "I came here to beat them. That's all that matters."

Grid pulled up the item descriptions.

---

**[Big Poisonous Rat's Gallbladder]**
A gallbladder filled with poison.

Upon consumption, inflicts poisoning for 10 minutes and triggers multiple debuffs.
However, permanently increases poisoning and confusion tolerance by **0.03%** afterwards.

Weight: 1

---

**[Big Poisonous Rat's Leather]**
Smelly and tough leather.

Difficult to use due to the persistent odor.

Weight: 30

---

"Wow."

Grid's eyes widened. He'd never seen an item that permanently boosted resistance to abnormal states before.

*Rich players will pay through the nose for these gallbladders.*

His status condition immunity made resistance items worthless to him. But for the other two billion users? Status effects were an eternal problem. Everyone needed to raise their resistances.

*This would fetch at least a million won.* Grid closed the item window. *But I'm not listing it.*

Putting it on the auction house meant strengthening potential rivals. Better to keep it in-house.

*Stockpile them. Sell to guild members only.*

Not for free, of course. Grid approached another tent and peered inside. Two more hamsters, curled together in sleep.

"Another couple?"

Complex emotions churned in his chest. *Do I have to hunt couples every time?*

He was destroying families. Grid hesitated, then shook his head. NPCs deserved consideration. Monsters? That way lay madness.

He steeled himself and split the +7 Sword Ghost into its twin forms. The blade separated into a longsword and shortsword with a metallic whisper. Grid activated Pagma's Swordsmanship, Transcend. His arms blurred.

**Peng!**

**Pepepepeong!**

Energy blades erupted from the longsword, each strike heavy with destructive force. The shortsword's projections were smaller, stealthier. Grid bombarded the tent without creating much disturbance. The surrounding hamsters slept on, oblivious.

"Muoong! It hurts!"

"Human! Kill! Muong!"

The couple woke to carnage, their nest shredded around them. Rage contorted their features. They snatched up tridents and charged.

They didn't make it far. The God Hands materialized, four golden constructs wielding Mjolnir.

**Peok!**

**Peok peok peok!**

"Muong! Muong! Muong!"

The hammers struck in perfect alternation, left to right, an endless chain of impacts. The hamsters locked into infinite stiffness, bodies jerking with each blow. Their health bars plummeted. Grid stepped in for the killing strikes.

> [You have defeated a big poisonous rat.]
> [33,842,391 experience has been acquired.]
> [A big poisonous rat's gallbladder has been acquired.]

"The drop rate is surprisingly high."

Grid paused. No, that was wrong. An item granting permanent resistance increases couldn't have a high drop rate. It defied game balance.

"Not high drop rate." He nodded to himself. "Just my **Good Luck** stat at work."

Sixteen points. Grid placed enormous significance on those sixteen points. Objectively, it meant nothing. Jude had twenty intelligence, and look how that turned out. But Grid couldn't help the warm feeling in his chest. Good luck. After years of having none, he'd finally earned some.

"The hunting pattern is simple enough." Grid moved toward the next tent. "Stun them with the God Hands while they sleep, then finish it. Easy."

The wide spacing between tents played in his favor. As long as he didn't make too much noise, he'd be fine. Grid smiled with grim satisfaction as he located the next couple.

And the next.

And the next.

*Dammit.*

Grid's hands stilled as the dying hamsters reached for each other, paws intertwining in their final moments. This was brutal work. If a title existed for "Couple Slaughterer," he'd probably earned it by now.

'Are you feeling compassion for creatures?' Braham's voice dripped with scorn. 'That is a severe weakness.'

"They look cute, don't they?" Grid's voice came out rougher than intended. "Loving each other like that. Monster or not."

He didn't understand why the game forced him to hunt couples specifically. Some psychopath on the development team had a twisted sense of humor.

"Alright. Outskirts cleared."

Five hundred tents sprawled across the area, packed with hamsters. He'd worked the perimeter methodically, tent by tent. Now he pressed deeper. The circular formation meant the tents grew denser toward the center. One mistake and he'd aggro four rats at once.

"Not the worst problem to have."

The hamsters gave experience comparable to true blood vampires, but their overall combat ability fell short. True bloods varied by level, of course. Grid was thinking of the average ones. And if true bloods weren't a threat, then multiple vampires simultaneously weren't an issue either.

"I need to thin their numbers before nap time ends." Grid flexed his fingers. "Time to get serious."

**Suuuk.**

Four golden hands materialized behind him. Grid felt the mana regeneration rate increase, fifty percent faster than normal. He gestured.

"Fire."

**Pepepepeok!**

Magic Missiles rained down on the sleeping hamsters.

**Taack!**

Grid charged with the God Hands flanking him. The hamsters scrambled to defend, to counterattack. The synergy between God Hands and Mjolnirs crushed their efforts.

"Revolve."

**Jjeejeeeong!**

The vampire cities had honed Grid's combat efficiency. Rather than using the God Hands purely for defense, he handled enemy attacks directly while the constructs swung Mjolnir in continuous assault. Once the target entered stiffness?

"Linked Kill."

**Puok! Puk! Puk puk!**

Execution.

"Good."

Four hamsters down. Two couples erased. Grid moved through the wreckage, collecting drops with practiced ease.

"Hm?"

Something caught his eye in the corner of the tent. Familiar. Jarringly modern. A frying pan.

Grid blinked. He picked it up and pulled up the item information.

"You've got to be kidding me..."
